# Seamless mobility to, through, and from space
It starts with 100% reusable Nova rockets.
Watch the video
![Nova rocket illustration](https://www.stokespace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/Group-28814-1-308x700.png)
## Nova: Radically improving access to and from orbit 
We’re unlocking the space economy by harnessing the power of full and rapid reusability with Nova, the world’s first medium-lift 100% reusable rocket. Nova offers affordable access to, through, and from space with a 20x reduced cost to orbit.Our fully reusable upper-stage vehicle delivers on-demand access to any orbit at any time. Its unmatched capabilities enable dynamic space operations, including capture, reposition, long-dwell operations, and return of assets, as well as space cargo and logistics missions. 
[Learn more about nova](https://www.stokespace.com/</nova>)
## Full reusability is built in from the start.
Stage 1 engineReentry heat shieldReusable upper stageStage 2 engine 
![Stoke Space hotfires its stage 1 engine](https://www.stokespace.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/S1E_fstand_hotfire_dec11_4-1-700x467.jpg)
Vertical hotfire of Zenith, our full-flow staged combustion engine, December 2024
![Heat shield](https://www.stokespace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/Heat-shield-1-1-700x389.jpg)
Reentry heat shield demonstrated at flight heating conditions, February 2024
![Hopper](https://www.stokespace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/HopperFull-2-2-700x389.jpg)
Flight demonstration of full-scale prototype of reusable upper stage, September 2023
![Full-thrust hotfire of stage 2](https://www.stokespace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/Stage-2-hotfire-1-1-700x389.jpg)
Full-thrust hotfire of stage 2 engine, February 2024
![View of barrels on the production floor at Stoke Space](https://www.stokespace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/Barrels_landscape-view_Nov-2024-700x525.jpg)
## Vertically integrated operations
Our 168,000-square-foot headquarters is home to our vertically integrated design and manufacturing operations. Leveraging next-generation tools and methods, Stoke’s rocket engines, structures, and avionics are built in days, not months or years. And with our test facility just a three-hour drive away, we test and iterate with unprecedented speed. 
WATCH: Year in review
![The team working](https://www.stokespace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/Frame-10-1-1-700x420.jpg)
## Unlimited human potential, on Earth and in space
We’re setting new benchmarks for sustainability by slashing atmospheric impact by 98% compared to today’s most prolific rockets. Our vision is to foster a booming space economy that not only propels human ambition, but does so with an unwavering commitment to environmental stewardship, making the space economy both sustainable and scalable. 
[Join us](https://www.stokespace.com/</careers>)
## Keep up to date with news from Stoke Space.
We’re on a mission and we want you to be a part of that journey. Stay up to date with major news and announcements from Stoke.

generated_description:
**Stoke Space: Revolutionizing Space Transportation**

Stoke Space, founded in 2019, is based in Seattle, WA, and is among the emerging stars of the space exploration sector, having participated in Y Combinator's W21 batch. The company is not just another player in the space race; it’s on a dedicated mission: to enable seamless mobility to, through, and from space with 100% reusable rockets.

### What They Do

The company's flagship rocket, Nova, is the world’s first medium-lift rocket designed to be fully reusable. This radical reusability promises a game-changing reduction in launch costs—up to 20 times cheaper than traditional options. With Nova, Stoke Space aims to unlock a thriving space economy by offering on-demand access to various orbits and dynamic space operations. 

Ever focused on speed and efficiency, Stoke utilizes a vertically integrated approach to design and manufacture its rockets. Their 168,000-square-foot headquarters allows for rapid production cycles, enabling them to build rocket engines and structures in mere days, not months. This means they can test and iterate their designs with unprecedented speed. 

### The Team and Leadership

Currently, Stoke Space has a dedicated team of 85 employees led by CEO Andy Lapsa, who shares a vision with industry influencers like Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos: making space travel as routine as commercial flights. Their Group Partner, Aaron Epstein, also plays a key role in guiding the company's strategic direction.

### Sustainability Commitment

Beyond engineering innovations, Stoke Space is committed to sustainability. The company has designed its rockets to minimize atmospheric impact by 98% compared to current leading models. This reflects a broader vision: a space economy that not only meets human ambition but does so responsibly, ensuring environmental stewardship.

### Recent Developments

Stoke is making headlines not just for its technological advancements but also for securing significant funding. Recently, they announced a $260 million Series C investment, aimed at furthering their mission and enhancing their already impressive capabilities.

### Get Involved

Stoke Space is inviting followers to join them on their journey. You can stay updated through their website and social channels to witness this exciting evolution in space exploration.

For more information, visit [Stoke Space's website](https://www.stokespace.com).
